In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's how you can define this function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(str, ' ')
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            println(line)
            line = "$word"
        else
            line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    println(line) # Print the last line after the loop.
end
```

You can call this function with an example string:

```julia
wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit")
```
This will print:

```julia
Lorem
ipsum dolor
sit amet,
consectetur
adipiscing
elit
```
